abstract: A special committee of Dell’s board again criticized a stock repurchase proposal by Carl C. Icahn, arguing that his plan suffered from a financing shortfall that made it less valuable than the company’s planned $24.4 billion sale to Michael S. Dell.
snippet: A special committee of Dell’s board again criticized a stock repurchase proposal by Carl C. Icahn, arguing that his plan suffered from a financing shortfall that made it less valuable than the company’s planned $24.4 billion sale to Michael S. Del...
lead_paragraph: A special committee of Dell Inc.‘s board again criticized a stock repurchase proposal by Carl C. Icahn on Monday, arguing that his plan suffered from a financing shortfall that made it less valuable than the company’s planned $24.4 billion sale to Michael S. Dell.

headline.main: Dell Special Committee Criticizes Icahn Proposal, Again

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
